title: [Seminar] Formal Verification of Middleware for Real-Time Distributed Systems
content: title:[Seminar] Formal Verification of Middleware for Real-Time Distributed Systems date:2022-03-18T00:00:00Z link:https://cs.kaist.ac.kr/board/view?bbs_id=events&bbs_sn=10084&page=1&skey=&svalue=&menu=86 content:Title: Formal Verification of Middleware for Real-Time Distributed Systems Friday, March 11 · 11:00am – 12:15pm Google Meet joining info Video call link: https://meet.google.com/dkb-qqfd-npd Speaker: 김윤승 박사 (서울대학교, yoonseung.kim＠sf.snu.ac.kr) Abstract: Guaranteeing the correctness of real-time distributed systems is challenging due to the complexity that arises from the nondeterminism of asynchronous behaviors. To tame the complexity, PALSware has been proposed as a middleware component that constructs a logically synchronous environment on top of physically asynchronous hardware and network systems. In this talk, I will present VeriPALS, a formally verified C implementation of PALSware, together with a verification framework for application systems on top of it. In the framework, we devised a method that lifts an arbitrary untimed program semantics (e.g., CompCert Clight) to a timed semantics. We also lift CompCert's proof to guarantee the correctness of distributed systems with compiled assembly programs. As a result, the framework provides an executable abstract system model, enabling efficient application system testing. Bio: Yoonseung Kim is currently a postdoctoral researcher at Seoul National University, Korea. His research interests lie in formally verifying real-time distributed systems by interactive theorem proving. He received Ph.D. in Computer Science at Seoul National University, advised by Prof. Chung-Kil Hur in 2021, and B.S. in Computer Science/Mathematics at KAIST in 2013. location: https://meet.google.com/dkb-qqfd-npd tag:csweb.calendar
